subclusters.subcluster_name: Metabolic Rate Reduction and Mitochondrial Function Rate of Living Theory
Oxidative Stress and Free Radical Rate of Living Theory
Metabolic Rate and Energy Expenditure Rate of Living Theory
Temperature-Dependent Rate of Living Theory via Thermosensitive Signaling

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Metabolic Rate Reduction and Mitochondrial Function Rate of Living Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on metabolic rate reduction via mitochondrial electron transport chain disruption and genetic mutations in C. elegans linking metabolism directly to longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Stress and Free Radical Rate of Living Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes resting metabolic rate driving ROS production and oxidative damage accumulation as the main aging mechanism.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Stress and Free Radical Rate of Living Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links whole-body metabolic rate to oxidative DNA damage and glycation, highlighting oxidative stress as a key aging driver.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Stress and Free Radical Rate of Living Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on ROS-induced damage and antioxidant enzyme activity modulating aging, consistent with free radical mechanisms.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Metabolic Rate and Energy Expenditure Rate of Living Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Centers on resting metabolic rate, energy expenditure for homeostasis, and body size scaling as determinants of aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Metabolic Rate and Energy Expenditure Rate of Living Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes metabolic rate as the key determinant of aging speed, modulated by environmental factors like gravity affecting metabolism.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Metabolic Rate and Energy Expenditure Rate of Living Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights total lifetime energy expenditure and body size scaling as central to lifespan determination via metabolic rate.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Stress and Free Radical Rate of Living Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links metabolic rate to free radical damage and lifespan, including food restriction effects lowering metabolism to extend life.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Rate of Aging Control Paradigm
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on controlling the fundamental biological aging rate itself rather than disease management, emphasizing healthspan extension.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Temperature-Dependent Rate of Living Theory via Thermosensitive Signaling
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes temperature effects on lifespan mediated by TRPA-1 and DAF-16/FOXO signaling, showing stage-specific modulation of aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Metabolic Rate and Energy Expenditure Rate of Living Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes fixed total lifetime energy expenditure and inverse metabolic rate-lifespan relationship across species.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Metabolic Rate and Energy Expenditure Rate of Living Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Studies metabolic rate variation with age and its role in aging, including food restriction effects on metabolic homeostasis.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Metabolic Rate and Energy Expenditure Rate of Living Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Pearl’s theory linking metabolic rate inversely to lifespan, emphasizing energy expenditure as cause of aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Temperature-Dependent Rate of Living Theory via Thermosensitive Signaling
theory_assignments.reasoning: Shows temperature effects on metabolic rate and aging in ectotherms, supporting temperature-dependent metabolic aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Temperature-Dependent Rate of Living Theory via Thermosensitive Signaling
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on lipid homeostasis and membrane fluidity regulation at different temperatures affecting lifespan in C. elegans.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Metabolic Rate and Energy Expenditure Rate of Living Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes inverse relationship between metabolic rate and lifespan, with energy metabolism as primary aging driver.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Stress and Free Radical Rate of Living Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links metabolic rate to entropy production and oxidative damage, with protective and repair mechanisms modulating aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Metabolic Rate and Energy Expenditure Rate of Living Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Analogizes organisms to machines wearing out faster at higher metabolic rates, supporting fixed total energy expenditure concept.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Metabolic Rate Reduction and Mitochondrial Function Rate of Living Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes genetic metabolic rate reduction increasing stress resistance and longevity, linking metabolism to free radical theory.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Metabolic Rate Reduction and Mitochondrial Function Rate of Living Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on metabolic rate reduction in C. elegans mutants extending lifespan by lowering oxidative stress.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Metabolic Rate and Energy Expenditure Rate of Living Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Combines rate-of-living with resource allocation and extrinsic mortality theories, emphasizing metabolic rate’s role in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stem Cell Replication Limit Rate of Living Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Revised rate of living theory focusing on finite stem cell replication capacity and replication-induced exhaustion as aging drivers.
